reviews.review_msg: Way to much information for a first year class. If you're taking it as a science requirement, and you're from the Arts faculties, get ready for LOTS of work in this class.
Way to much info at once. It's hard to keep on top of material occasionally.

Too much information for a first year course.  A science background is essential to get a decent grade.  Kind of like fishing the dark when studying for the exams.  She does not direct you any way whatsoever in what you should focus on.TAs are also useless.
don't take it

The worst class I have taken. I expected the content to be easy, which it was. But the test were quit literally not doable. Questions were all over the place, not specific (and you would lose marks for not thinking the exact same way as the ta), time limit was ridiculous (never once actually finished a test), and ta/professor help non existent.

The prof did not provide lectures (barely informative lecture slides only) during online learning and the final couple chapters were completely self-taught. You could do well in the class by only reading the textbook. Lectures were not engaging and prof showed little interest in teaching. Projects for tutorials had unclear instructions and grading

Kin110 is a information course and the way he delivered it is pretty standard. The test sections and number of questions are clearly stated . Slides cover about half the material, read in the respective section and write down notes by hand will help you remember. If you're not good at memorization or have not taken biology I would suggest avoid it.

Took BPK 110 as I heard it was an easy b-sci but I should've looked at this page before taking it with Vieira. If I could give him a zero I would, it was the most unorganized and uninspired class . The grade breakdown is crazy, 84% is based on exams and the other things are class assignments. One of which takes hours to do but is only 6%. AVOID HIM

I took BPK110 with him as a GPA booster but it was almost the opposite. He is disorganized and refuses to use canvas so he has a website that is hard to use and confusing. His lecture dont help so I solely relied on the textbook. Content was interesting but Vieira was dull, boring and monotone. I would recommend avoiding Vieira at all costs.

Do yourself a favour and never take this guys class. I was so confident after each midterm/exam and he was the hardest marker(gave .3 marks or 1.27 marks). If you take 110 with him, the book is your holy grail. Honestly the curve is the only thing gonna save you

he is an okay prof but his multiple choice questions are SOOOO hard. Its honestly better to get short answer questions. Not very clear in lectures. Very monotone and his lectures are extremely boring especially being there for 2 hours. Shows a lot of unnecessary diagrams, but his projects and quizzes are super easy

Super long lectures. This guy is pretty boring and unclear. Don't bother going to lecture. Tutorials cover most of the material and include easy little quizzes for marks. If you read the textbook you'll be fine. Easy tests and definitely a GPA booster.

I believe it is the prof's first time teaching a class.  he is not very enthusiastic about the class.  his slides are somewhat relative to the MT.  Key point is to study and memorize everything in the textbook and it will be alright.  Dietary assessment took FOREVER to do.
easy class, never went to the lecture (but u'd understand better if u go). MTs are pretty fair, similiar to the sample MTs! Good class.

I loved the class!  His lectures are clear & easy to understand. MTs are very fair, he has sample MTs for you to copy down in tutorials! It was not bad at all,cept the project was very long & kinda confusing because he didn't explain his expectations well enough. Rushed through alot of lecture details though.
Very dry monotone prof. His tests are hard and sometimes don't make sense. Uses a lot of diagrams in lecture which don't necessarily connect with the material on the tests.
No Comments
This class was great and relevant. She relates well to students and puts in a great effort to ensure they understand. Amazing proff.
Amazing Proff and TA. I sincerely enjoyed her. She went well above and beyond what is expected by a teacher.
The course was easy but she was very scattered. She tells you one thing and can mean the opposite. Don't recommend her.

The most boring class I've ever had in four years. Didn't learn anything from lectures. Did well despite not attending class and got accused of cheating as a result. Should have gotten an A- but got a B because she apparently changed the grading scheme last minute. Kept saying she couldn't help me because she was going away.
One of the worst profs ever. Very inconsistent notes, lecture doesn't add anything to the textbooks, makes the TA do all the work. Avoid avoid avoid!!!

Just go through lecture slides and webct study questions and you'll be fine, you won't even have to attend all the lectures. Tutorials seem to be mostly about clarifying diet analysis, ton of material but very relevant. Midterm time allotment was frustrating but final seemed ok. Not an easy A but it's probably worth it to take the class anyway.

High interest in the subject, huge amount of studying for her final. Midterm was fairly easy but only 50 minutes to write, then lecture afterward... Useless quizzes to start every tutorial. Diet analysis is interesting but tedious, due every couple of weeks. Her jokes are well... crickets. Prepare to be patronized about webCT to start every class.
Amazing prof, her lecture notes are simple and explained very well. She is just great.

THE BEST prof I've ever had! I looked forward to getting to class at 8:30am because her class was amazing. Super super passionate, a great speaker, relates to students well and tells you exactly what you need to know, and emphasizes what's important. I'm not even in KIN but I would take another KIN course with her simply because she's AMAZING!

Diana is a great lecturer.  Though attendance is not mandatory, I suggest you go for the clicker participation marks, and also the fact that she is really good at what she does.  What she says will be on the midterm is on the midterm; there are no surprises.  Her passion in the subject and her presentation skills are inspiring too.
Great lecturer, relates so much of the lecture material to real life. She shows her self-confidence through the way she speaks.

Really great prof! Very passionate about nutrition and was very nice. I recommend to get her as a prof, I would enjoy being in her lectures again, lectures are interesting and assignments are fairly easy, great prof overall, she also says funny jokes in class which is a bonus =)at least a 9 on the scale

Diana is an excellent prof. She doesn't try tricking you with her exams; anything she says will be on there always is. Do the study questions as they are an excellent source for studying. Amazing attitude and is passionate about kinesiology as well.  Definitely a GPA booster if you study for exams and do well on assignments- which are not difficult
Took kin 110 and 140 with her, she is the best prof I've ever had.
One of the best profs I have ever had she makes the material so interesting. Exams were a bit tricky but I would take another class with her if I could.
Difficult course for anyone who doesn't care for science, but Diana is passionate about the material and also very organized and clear with her lectures. TA Rita was forgettable.
A hard marker, the exams are fair, you either know the material or you don't. Great prof, very helpful and really easy to approach. Plus she is always really engaged with what she has to say.

While I love Diana and her teaching style, the course is weighted heavily on the exams which are killer. You get easy marks for the diet analysis, group project and participation, but unless you memorize the textbook, you're screwed. I walked into AND OUT OF the exams confident, and when I got my marks back I was so stunned. Good prof- hard marker.

She is a great prof. Explains things really clearly, and lets you know what she expects out of her students. Do the exam practice problems! HOWEVER TA's weren't all that great. Hard to get in touch with, and tutorials weren't very helpful. Diet Analysis i found quite pointless and should be taken out of the course. . .

Diana bedoya maybe easy to understand, but her exams are super hard!! Diet analysis is hard and you will bang ur head figuring it out! Final is cumulative, STAY away from this class!! HOrrible T.A Barbie and Diana is horrible period!! Useless crap to memorize, take a different elective if u can !!

Super easy class, easy exams and easy projects. Very helpful prof and keeps you engaged during class. Definitely recommend taking this class just to learn about health and exercise. The textbook was really expensive and not worth the buyback, not needed to get an A (even though she says you do) except first midterm has some stuff from the text.

Very good prof indeed. She is very lenient on exam question. Her lecture slides covers 90% of the materials you would need for the exam. Though Kin110 hardest would be diet analysis and group project (very time consuming).

Finally a prof from our generation. Makes science understandable for those of us with no science background. She is funny and super positive. TA was less helpful, almost a detriment because she often didn't know anything. Diana is a remarkable prof. It's great to see her get excited about what she teaches. I will definitely wait to take Kin 140 wit
Don't waste your time. First year course that requires quite a bit of work.

Everybody is right, kin 110 was a lot of memorization. Its nutrition, what do you really expect? aka suck it up buttercup. I took it via distance, so i didnt get a chance to listen to her lecture. She went way out of her way to help me out. above & beyond. Give her kudos. REALLY cares about her students, as long as you're not a complete snot to her
one of the BEST teachers at SFU. lots of notes but she is extremely helpful.  If you need help, be sure to ask! memorize class notes.
dist-ed. totally recommended.  easy and very interesting.esp, if u r a bio major, and good at memorizing. and prof's exams and assignments were also very easy and fair.

Completely brutal at forcing us to write notes down by hand instead of allowing us to print them off online (my hand still hurts after every lecture...). I can't believe she punished all the students and was incapable of realizing which ones were the bad ones who weren't paying attention in class. Would it really kill you if you told them to leave?

This course was very interesting, but I can't say that Penny was a great professor. She kicked people out of a huge lecture for talking, frequently raised her voice at students, and the text was pretty much useless. Also, my TA didn't even speak English, making this course not only difficult, but really frustrating too.
Straight up y'all, Dont Take This Class with her, wayyyy to much work for a 100 level course man!!!

Wow Penny has to be the biggest waste of money a university has ever spent on a teacher. The class I took was nutrition not ****ing BIO12. I hate her annoying voice, whenever you're trying to do an exam her high pitched squelch starts talking. She reads straight off the stupid slides that she has word for word so there is no point going to class.

DO the study questions and practice online questions - they show up almost verbatim on each of the three exams. Although this was an extreme amount of work for a course, it was sooo interesting that it was definetly manageable. Penny is so helpful, especially with her online discussion boards with quick responses and helpful answers :)

Wow, this was too much of a work load for a 100 level course... although I admit half of it was a more detailed Bio 12. The midterms are crazy; she asks you for the smallest details! Don't take this class if you don't have to!
Wow this is a great prof! She always gives interesting lectures and all you have to do is memorize lecture notes and you're good!

How to get an A. Answer all practice short response questions (using your lecture notes) and memorize your answers. Do all the T/F and MC practice tests several times before the exams. Written response exam questions (including final) arent overly detailed so just know the basics (non-technical stuff). And don't read the text it's a waste of time.

This teacher was very knowledgable, but if you do not have a science background or if you don't have an amazing memory you will not do well in the course!! This was the hardest course I have ever taken!!! Test's were on the tiny little details and impossible, to pass, for a non science major.
Although this teacher is nice, I really don't like this course much at all because of the amount of material that we have to know and it's a real pain. I'm just glad that nightmare is over...

Know the lecture notes inside out, because they are very picky with marking on the exam. I answered a question directly from the lecture notes and they somehow managed to take marks off, don't know how that works. Do the online questions (mc/T/F/fill in the blank, etc.) though, some of them do appear on the exam. We didn't need to know the text.

kin 110 is not an easy course, but thank god that we had a great TA (Pooneh afkari) who was very helpful. She clarifies all parts of the dietary analysis to the students very well. She has a nice personality too.

Simply one of the BEST profs you can wish for! Notes given to fill in during class are amazing and perfect for studying. Complicated information is made very clear. She is highly organized, friendly and willing to help. Seems to genuinely want students to do well in her class! I will be seeking out her other classes to take her again. AWESOME!

Very good notes, very clear to understand.  She just decided to not post her notes anymore since apparently our class was talkative and now she's become mega strict overnight.... i dont know what happened.

this class by no means is easy. for each lecture, there is a lot of information, and if you don't have a science background it is a lot of work. one positive thing about this course was penny, seh is a very good prof, with excellent lecture notes. they are clear, and is totally available (and helpful) if you need extra help. take kin 110 with penny
She's really easy, and nice.  Just memorize the lecture notes, and do the multiple choice questions online. It's an easy A+
she's a trickster.

She is a great prof. Well-prepared notes though there are lots to study. Knows stuff well.Willing to offer help esp. when the dietary analysis comes!She answered all questions really in details to help students out!!!Highly recommended.

She is very friendly and willing to answer questions. For the dietary analysis she replys to every posting in the discussion with is amazing considering how many ppl have questions sometimes the same ones!! But overall a very nice person and knows the material well, although tests is based alot on memorizing the material she covers.
No Comments

Great course with lots of useful info.  Lots of memorization but if you pay attention to her and her notes, you'd do fine.  Her online practice is esp. helpful.  She expects quite alot from students though (tiny details on the exam).  Final is easier than the midterms!!

They only reason I took this course was because Penny was teaching it this semester. She is so well organized, and always willing to help you out. Keep up with her study questions and you'll learn a lot, and probably get a good grade.

Penny is a superb intsructor. Course has an absolute ton of infromation though, and if you fall behind you will be making many trips to 7/11 the days before the exam. Lectures are interesting, and Penny is very helpful if you ask her outside of class.

She's very approachable and will offer great strategies to improve your grades, if you need help. Pay attention to the mc online and study questions and you'll do well in her exams. Lots of readings and memorization.

The clss is not as good as I expected it to be, it is boring and, definitely not an easy class, lots of memorization. There is soo much reading and holy information overload!!! Don't take the class unless you're really really interested in the subject, i thought i was, but am definitely not now!!!
She makes her point. She does know her stuff. It's one of the easiest courses in Kin.
I fell asleep about 90% of the time. She tends to turn her back to the class and read off her powerpoint, which causes me to fall asleep instantly. Two thumbs down!

Boring class and not what I expected.  It focused more on the biological aspects of nutrition such as digestion and nutrient components (suchs as lipids, amino acids, etc.) instead of actually informing us on how to live a healthy lifestyle. She touched very briefly on these topics. Awful instructor

I think she's okay, but don't expect this to be an "exciting" class...LOL~~it is actually super boring!!! That's only my personal opinion, however.  If you studied well and do her practice MC and fill in the blanks she post on her website, you should be fine for exams.
This class is hard, meaning the context and ALL the things that you have to memorize.  Also, there's so much work that has to be done, like a diet analysis that is almost 40 pages long.

her lecture notes r great!! very straight to the point & gives enough info for our exams&midterms. however, i believe she needs more practice w/ talkin in lecture since she always makes mistake on her words. nonetheless, she replied u almost immediately when u message her for help. GREAT!

Penny is a terrible professor. she does not practice good teaching princibles such as elaborating on material or relating it to the student. she simply reads off slides. I don't pay thousands of dollars to be read too.
Very good prof, very knowledgeable, not to mention HOT.  She's the reason why I wake up early to go to class.
had her as a ta...she was alright, but hard marker, no real personality
Penny is an excellent teacher. The notes are organized and clear. However, the course requires alot of memorization!
No Comments
don't take this as a class to slack off in...a lot of memorization involved, but very interesting material. very good prof, clear and very helpful.
DON'T take this course if you are thinking of keeping a certain degree of GPA... This course is axxl!!!
Need to memorize lots of stuff in this course. Have to be familiar with all the functions of vitamin and how they work in bodies.
GREAT teacher and great notes! very clear on what to be tested. easy to understand and easy to reach. Readings are very important Want to take his class again.
Matthew is AWESOME! Very interesting and democratic. He gives great examples to clarify the concept in the course.
he is fun~you cant image how detail his lecture notes are. exam is fair, if you study, you get it, if no, well~ ~~
Matthew is very thoughtful and LOVES kinesiology!! Everything he does is for his students and makes lecture really fun! He is an awesome prof who really cares about his students and his work!
This class was wicked. Played "who wants to be a nutritionist" and gives you 1% to final grade. I took it summer of 2009. Wicked guy, wicked class.

HES SUCH AN AWESOME PROF! he tries to make nutrition fun with his games and jokes - and it works! he gives great notes and tries to make the 6 classes of nutrients exciting considering the amount of crap that is. would take another class with him, you must study hard but it pays off.
Very thoughtful prof, made sure material was understandable and clear. Textbook reading may be needed for some sections as the class was intersession and a lot of material is covered each class.

He really is a great guy and a great prof. He is obviously very enthusiastic about the course and he tries his best to make the class interactive and to accommodate people's suggestions. I would definitely take another class with him.

really nice prof....very geeky when it comes to nutrition...tries to make some jokes and lighten things up (bad joker :P) this was an intersession course, very rapid if you're not good at memorizing, this course will be somehwat of a challenge. very good content! his midterm was fair, his final was ridiculously hard. too many small details
he's a good guy

Funny guy, good lecturer...first midterm and final were fair, second midterm was unfairly difficult...don't take this course if you think it's an easy science option, cause it ain't!!  too much of everthing, but very informative...
